t: Jeremiah 2
Israel Accused of Apostasy
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:

“Go and announce directly to Jerusalem that this is what the Lord*s says: I*pn remember the loyalty of your youth, your*ln love as a bride — how*ln you followed me in the wilderness, in*ln a land not sown.
Israel*ln was holy to the Lord,*s the*ln firstfruits of his harvest. All*ln who ate of it found themselves guilty; disaster*ln came on them.” This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Hear*pn the word of the Lord,*s house of Jacob and*ln all families of the house of Israel.
This*ln is what the Lord*s says: What*ln fault did your ancestors find in me that*ln they went so far from me, followed*ln worthless idols, and*ln became worthless themselves?

They*ln stopped asking, “Where is the Lord*s who*ln brought us from the land of Egypt, who*ln led us through the wilderness, through*ln a land of deserts and ravines, through*ln a land of drought and darkness, a*ln land no one traveled through and*ln where no one lived?”
I*ln brought you to a fertile land to*ln eat its fruit and bounty, but*ln after you entered, you defiled my land; you*ln made my inheritance detestable.

The*ln priests quit asking, “Where is the Lord?”*s The*ln experts in the law no longer knew me, and*ln the rulers rebelled against me. The*ln prophets prophesied by Baal and*ln followed useless idols.
Therefore,*pn I will bring a case against you again. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. I*pn will bring a case against your children’s children.
Cross*ln over to the coasts of Cyprus and take a look. Send*ln someone to Kedar and consider carefully; see*ln if there has ever been anything like this:
Has*ln a nation ever exchanged its gods? (But*ln they were not gods!) Yet*ln my people have exchanged their Glory for*ln useless idols.
Be*ln appalled at this, heavens; be*ln shocked and utterly desolated! This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
For*pn my people have committed a double evil: They*ln have abandoned me, the*ln fountain of living water, and*ln dug cisterns for themselves - cracked*ln cisterns that cannot hold water.
Consequences of Apostasy
Is*pn Israel a slave? Was*ln he born into slavery? Why*ln else has he become a prey?
The*ln young lions have roared at him; they*ln have roared loudly. They*ln have laid waste his land. His*ln cities are in ruins, without inhabitants.
The*ln men of Memphis and Tahpanhes have*ln also broken your skull.
Have*ln you not brought this on yourself by*ln abandoning the Lord*s your God while*ln he was leading you along the way?

Now*ln what will you gain by*ln traveling along the way to Egypt to*ln drink the water of the Nile? What*ln will you gain by*ln traveling along the way to Assyria to*ln drink the water of the Euphrates?

Your*ln own evil will discipline you; your*ln own apostasies will reprimand you. Recognize*ln how evil and bitter it is for*ln you to abandon the Lord*s your God and*ln to have no fear of me. This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God*s of Armies.
For*pn long ago I broke your yoke; I*ln tore off your chains. You*ln insisted, “I will not serve!” On*ln every high hill and*ln under every green tree you*ln lay down like a prostitute.
I*pn planted you, a choice vine from*ln the very best seed. How*ln then could you turn into a*ln degenerate, foreign vine?
Even*pn if you wash with lye and*ln use a great amount of bleach, the*ln stain of your iniquity is still in front of me. This*lg is the Lord God’s*s declaration.

How*pn can you protest, “I am not defiled; I*ln have not followed the Baals”? Look*ln at your behavior in the valley; acknowledge*ln what you have done. You*ln are a swift young camel twisting*ln and turning on her way,

a*ln wild donkey at home in the wilderness. She*ln sniffs the wind in the heat of her desire. Who*ln can control her passion? All*ln who look for her will not become weary; they*ln will find her in her mating season.
Keep*ln your feet from going bare and*ln your throat from thirst. But*ln you say, “It’s hopeless; I*ln love strangers, and*ln I will continue to follow them.”
Like*pn the shame of a thief when he is caught, so*ln the house of Israel has been put to shame. They,*ln their kings, their officials, their*ln priests, and their prophets

say*ln to a tree, “You are my father,” and*ln to a stone, “You gave birth to me.” For*ln they have turned their back to me and*ln not their face, yet*ln in their time of disaster they beg, “Rise*ln up and save us!”
But*ln where are your gods you made for yourself? Let*ln them rise up and save you in*ln your time of disaster if they can, for*ln your gods are as numerous as your cities, Judah.
Judgment Deserved
Why*pn do you bring a case against me? All*ln of you have rebelled against me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
I*pn have struck down your children in vain; they*ln would not accept discipline. Your*ln own sword has devoured your prophets like*ln a ravaging lion.

Evil*ln generation, pay*ln attention to the word of the Lord!*s Have*ln I been a wilderness to Israel or*ln a land of dense darkness? Why*ln do my people claim, “We*ln will go where we want; we*ln will no longer come to you”?
Can*ln a young woman forget her jewelry or*ln a bride her wedding sash? Yet*ln my people have forgotten me for*ln countless days.
How*ln skillfully you pursue love; you*ln also teach evil women your ways.
Moreover,*ln your skirts are stained with*ln the blood of the innocent poor. You*ln did not catch them breaking and entering. But*ln in spite of all these things
you*ln claim, “I am innocent. His*ln anger is sure to turn away from me.” But*ln I will certainly judge you because*ln you have said, “I have not sinned.”
How*ln unstable you are, constantly*ln changing your ways! You*ln will be put to shame by Egypt just*ln as you were put to shame by Assyria.
Moreover,*ln you will be led out from here with*ln your hands on your head since*ln the Lord*s has rejected those you trust; you*ln will not succeed even with their help.
